intro: Dactylorhiza czerniakowskae, commonly known as the Czerniakowski's orchid, is a rare and endangered orchid species native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of pale yellow or greenish-white flowers. The plant is a terrestrial orchid that typically grows in moist, shaded woodland habitats. It has a complex root system and relies on mycorrhizal fungi for nutrient uptake, which is essential for its survival. Due to habitat loss and environmental changes, it is considered critically endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
